```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

colors<-c(
  "#e6e0d0", #1 background
  "#c04631", #2 red
  "#7aa03e", #3 green
  "#2a4c7e", #4 blue
  "#3d362f", #5 charcoal
  "#b9b064"  #6 greenish yellowish big curve
)

g<-ggplot()+ theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill=colors[1], colour='white'),
                   panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
                   panel.grid.minor = element_blank())

#making first curve
bound<-pi/4
scale<-.8
big.curve<-data.frame(
  y=sin(seq(bound*scale, -(bound+.4)*scale, length=10000))+.405,
  x=cos(seq(bound*scale, -(bound+.4)*scale, length=10000))-.9
)

small.curve<-data.frame(
  y=sin(seq(bound, -bound, length=10000))*.5-.28,
  x=-cos(seq(bound, -bound, length=10000))*.5+.53
)

diagonal<-data.frame(
  x=seq(0, .4, length=10000),
  y=seq(.25, -.15, length=10000)
)


g<-g+
  #big curve
  geom_path(data=big.curve, 
            aes(x=x, y=y), 
            colour=colors[6],
            size=1.3
            )+
  #small curve
  geom_path(data=small.curve, 
            aes(x=x, y=y), 
            colour=colors[4],
            size=1.3
            )+
  #black diagonal line
  geom_line(data=diagonal, 
            aes(x=x, y=y), 
            colour=colors[5],
            size=1.3
            )+
  
  
  coord_fixed()+
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-1,1), expand = c(0, 0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-1,1), expand = c(0, 0))+
  theme(axis.title.x=element_blank(),
        axis.text.x=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.x=element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.text.y=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y=element_blank())
g
```
